results.title: The Great diamond
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Math that counts”.
Repeated division is visualized several times in this humorous animated film. The Drok tribe attempt to smuggle the Great Diamond out of their castle by breaking it into four hundred and eighty-seven pieces. They put sixteen pieces into their boot heels - but how many boots will be needed in all?

results.title: The Great cover-up
results.creator_credit: Sonya Friedman, Henriette Montgomery and Texture Films
results.brief_description: Uses live action and animation to present observations about dress, including its significance as a means of self-expression, its role as part of the total design of an age, and the way in which it reflects prevailing political and social issues.

results.title: The Great chase [silent]
results.creator_credit: Castle Films and United World Films
results.brief_description: W. C. Fields earns himself a jot at the bank as a security guard after unwittingly foiling the getaway of bank robbers. Unfortunately he is then taken hostage by one of the robbers in another robbery attempt at the bank and forced to drive the getaway cark, with policemen hot on their tail. Possibly from the feature “The Bank dick” (also known as “The Bank detective), 1940.

results.title: The Great Chase
results.brief_description: Here is a cavalcade of the most hair-raising pursuits in film from the silent era: features sequences from “The Great Train Robbery” by pioneer Edwin S Porter; D.W.Griffith’s “Way Down East” with Lillian Gish; “The Mark of Zorro” starring Douglas Fairbanks Snr; Buster Keaton’s “The General” and many others. It is an exciting, funny and classic treat for young and old alike about the silent era. Rated: G

results.title: The Great Camel Race
results.creator_credit: Bill Leimbach, Richard Dennison, ABC-TV (Australia) and Orana Films
results.brief_description: The Great Camel Race, the longest animal endurance ever - from Alice Springs to the Gold Coast - is a rare example of the outback documentary that has a real story to tell. A story in which we can cheer the heroes and choose our villains!
results.creator_credit_for_label: Bill Leimbach, Richard Dennison, ABC-TV (Australia) and Orana Films

results.title: The Great Barriers
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Up a gum tree”.
Australia’s coasts are battleground’s where seaweeds, coral and mangroves fight for survival against the ravages of the ocean - a survival that is vital to the protection of the coast.

results.title: The Great adventure
results.brief_description: A classic study of man and nature in Central Sweden. It is a simple story of the eternal symmetry of nature; a mother fox preys upon a hen coop to feed her hungry cubs - the farmer preys upon the fox - the farmer’s dog chases a cub. In a second sequence two young boys rescue an otter from a hunter, and care for it through the four seasons. A beautifully sensitive evocation of the interdependence of animals and man’s relationship to them. Cannes Film Festival Award Winner, 1954.

results.title: The Great achievement
results.brief_description: This film tells of the part played by the New Zealand party, under Sir Edmund Hillary, in crossing the Antarctic continent in 1957. After wintering at Scott base the party sets out on the difficult and often frustrating trek to the Pole. The meeting with the Americans is shows with the arrival of Fuch’s party at Scott base. The film concludes with the triumphal homecoming to Wellington.
